intro: Anil ovina, commonly known as the woolly nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Anil ovina is often found in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to arid environments.
